prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Iris:
If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this.

Phoenix:
But this is your hood...
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. [caption] One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

response:
Okay, let's tackle this. So, the user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through the provided evidences and testimonies to find inconsistencies.

First, let's look at the testimonies. The testimonies are all from Butz (Testimony 0 to 6). Let me read through them. 

Testimony 0: He went to the shack around 9, so it was about 10:30 PM. Wait, wait. Wait, he says he went to the shack at around 9 PM, and that would have been about 10:30 PM? That doesn't make sense. Wait, maybe that's a typo or a mistake in the testimony. Alternatively, maybe he's confused about the time. Let me check the evidence again.

Looking at Evidence 7, the Weather Data. It mentions that on February 7, snow was from 7 PM to around 10:50 PM, and lightning from 10 PM to around 11 PM. The lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM. There's a note about Bikini seeing the murder around 11 PM, Larry (Butz) says the shack is about a five-minute walk from the bridge, and Phoenix's account at 11:06 PM in the courtyard. 

Testimony 0 says Butz went to the shack at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM. Wait, that timeline is conflicting. If he went to the shack at 9 PM, how does that relate to 10:30 PM? Maybe he meant he was there for a long time. But the problem comes when considering the snow and lightning times. 

Testimony 3: Butz says there was still some thunder but he went to check the bridge. According to the Weather Data, lightning was from 10 PM to 11 PM, and the bridge was struck at 10:45 PM. Testimony 2 says Butz saw the bridge on fire when he looked out the window. Then Testimony 5: He arrived at the bridge and Nick showed up less than a minute later. 

But let's look at Testimony 0 again. He says he went to the shack at around 9 PM and that would have been about 10:30 PM. Wait, that's confusing. If he went to the shack at 9 PM, why does he say "so it would have been about 10:30 PM"? That suggests that the time he's referring to is 10:30 PM. Maybe he's saying that he was at the shack from 9 PM until 10:30 PM. But the timeline of events: the murder happened around 11 PM, according to Bikini's statement. 

Now, looking at Evidence 7's details, there's a note that around 30 minutes passed between the fire starting and going out. The lightning struck at 10:45 PM. If the fire started then, it would have gone out around 11:15 PM. But the crime scene with Phoenix was at 11:06 PM. 

Wait, maybe Testimony 0 is conflicting with the Weather Data. If Butz says he went to the shack around 9 PM and that would have been about 10:30 PM, but the snow stopped around 10:50 PM. Also, in Testimony 3, he says there was still some thunder when he went to check, which aligns with the lightning ending around 11 PM. But if he went to the shack at 9 PM, that's during the snow period. 

But the contradiction might be in the timeline. For example, Testimony 5 says he arrived at the bridge and Nick showed up less than a minute later. But according to the weather data, the lightning struck the bridge at 10:45 PM. The fire would have started then. Phoenix's arrival at 11:06 PM, so Butz would have had to arrive around 11:05 PM. But if Butz left the shack (which is a five-minute walk from the bridge) when he saw the fire (around 10:45 PM), he should have arrived at the bridge around 10:50 PM, not matching the 11:06 PM time. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: He went to the shack at around 9 PM, and that time would be about 10:30 PM. Wait, that's a discrepancy. If he went to the shack at 9 PM, how does that make it 10:30 PM? Unless he's saying that he was there for an hour and a half. But perhaps the times don't add up. 

Wait, let me check the exact details. Testimony 0: "I went to the shack at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM..." That phrasing is odd. Maybe he's saying that he arrived at the shack around 9 PM and stayed until 10:30 PM. Or maybe it's a translation error. Alternatively, he's miscalculating the time. 

But the key is that according to the Weather Data (Evidence 7), snow stopped around 10:50 PM. In the conversation between von Karma and Butz, Butz mentions that when he went to check the bridge, the snow had pretty much stopped, which would be around 10:50 PM. So if Butz says he went to the shack around 9 PM and stayed until 10:30 PM, but the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, then the timeline might conflict. 

Wait, another angle. Testimony 0 says he went to the shack at around 9 PM, leading to 10:30 PM. But according to the Weather Data, the snow stopped at 10:50 PM. If Butz was in the shack until 10:30 PM, then when he left, it was still snowing. But in his testimony (Testimony 3), he says there was still some thunder when he went out. The thunder (lightning) was until around 11 PM. So that's consistent. 

Hmm. Maybe the contradiction is elsewhere. Let me check other testimonies. 

Testimony 5: Butz says he arrived at the bridge and Nick showed up less than a minute later. But according to the timeline in Evidence 7, Phoenix heard a scream around 11:06 PM. If Butz arrived at the bridge first and then Phoenix arrived a minute later, that would be around 11:06 PM. But the lightning strike was at 10:45 PM, which started the fire. The fire lasted about 30 minutes, so until 11:15 PM. But the murder occurred between 10-11 PM. 

Wait, the autopsy report (Evidence 11) states the time of death was between 10-11 PM. So Elise was killed then. But Phoenix found the body at 11:06 PM. 

Now, the contradiction might be in the timings. For example, Testimony 0 says Butz was at the shack from 9 PM until 10:30 PM, but the snow was still falling until 10:50 PM. Butz says in Testimony 3 that when he went out to check the bridge, it had "pretty much stopped snowing", which would align with 10:50 PM. But if he left the shack at 10:30 PM, the snow was still falling. Therefore, his statement about the snow having stopped contradicts the Weather Data. 

Wait, the user-provided Evidence 7 includes a note from the conversation: 'Butz:\nHold on... Well, it had pretty much stopped snowing... I guess about a five-minute walk?' So Butz claims that when he went to check the bridge, the snow had stopped. According to the Weather Data, the snow stopped around 10:50 PM. So if the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, Butz would have gone out after 10:45 PM, when the snow was stopping. But if Testimony 0 says he went to the shack at 9 PM and that would have been about 10:30 PM, which is before the snow stopped. Then when he went out (Testimony 3), the snow had stopped. But according to the timeline, he would have left the shack at 10:30 PM, which is before the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, so his claim that the snow had stopped is conflicting. 

Therefore, Testimony 0 (Butz saying he went to the shack at 9 PM leading to 10:30 PM) and the Weather Data (snow until 10:50 PM) contradict each other. Because if Butz left the shack at 10:30 PM, the snow was still ongoing, but he says in the conversation (in Evidence 7) that when he went to the bridge, the snow had stopped. So his testimony about the time he was at the shack contradicts the weather data. 

Thus, Testimony 0 (Butz's testimony about being at the shack from 9 PM until 10:30 PM) and Evidence 7 (Weather Data showing snow until 10:50 PM) contradict. But the user wants a pair of evidence and testimony. So which testimony number is that? 

Looking at the Testimony list: Testimony 0 is "I went to the shack at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM..." The contradiction is that if he left the shack at 10:30 PM, the snow was still ongoing (until 10:50 PM), but in his testimony (as part of Evidence 7's notes), he said that when he went to check the bridge, the snow had stopped. Therefore, the testimony about being at the shack until 10:30 PM (Testimony 0) contradicts the Weather Data (Evidence 7) which says snow continued until 10:50 PM, and his own statement in the testimony (when he went out, the snow had stopped). Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 0 and Evidence 7. 

But wait, the user wants the testimony to be from the Testimony list (0-6). So Testimony 0 is about the time he went to the shack. The contradiction is between Testimony 0 and Evidence 7. So the answer would be evidence 7 and testimony 0. 

Alternatively, maybe another contradiction. For example, Testimony 5: Butz says he arrived at the bridge and Nick showed up less than a minute later. According to Phoenix's account in Evidence 7, he arrived at 11:06 PM. If Butz arrived a minute before, that would be around 11:05 PM. But the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, starting the fire. The fire lasted 30 minutes, so until 11:15 PM. But if Butz arrived at 11:05 PM, then the fire was still burning. However, maybe this is not a contradiction. 

Alternatively, Testimony 2: Butz says he looked out the window and saw the bridge on fire. If the bridge was struck by lightning at 10:45 PM, then the fire started then. But according to the Weather Data, the lightning was from 10 PM to 11 PM, but the specific strike was at 10:45 PM. So when Butz saw the fire, it was at 10:45 PM. Then he went to check it out (Testimony 3), and arrived at the bridge (Testimony 5). But according to Evidence 7, Phoenix found the body at 11:06 PM. If Butz arrived at the bridge a minute before Phoenix, that's 11:05 PM. But the fire started at 10:45 PM, so there's a 20-minute gap. This would suggest Butz took 20 minutes to walk a five-minute distance, which contradicts his statement that the shack is a five-minute walk. 

So Testimony 5 (arriving at the bridge and Nick coming less than a minute later) and the timeline (fire started at 10:45 PM, Phoenix arrived at 11:06 PM) would suggest that Butz arrived around 11:05 PM, but he should have arrived much earlier if he left when the fire started. 

But how does this relate to the evidence? The evidence that the bridge was struck at 10:45 PM (Evidence 7) contradicts Testimony 5 if Butz says he arrived at the bridge and Nick came a minute later, which would be at 11:06 PM. Therefore, the time between the lightning strike (10:45 PM) and Phoenix's arrival (11:06 PM) is 21 minutes. If Butz left the shack when the fire started (10:45 PM), he should have arrived at the bridge by 10:50 PM (5-minute walk). But Phoenix didn't arrive until 11:06 PM. This discrepancy suggests Butz's testimony about the timing contradicts the evidence. 

But which testimony is that? Testimony 5 is about arriving at the bridge and Nick showing up a minute later. So if the lightning struck at 10:45 PM and Phoenix arrived at 11:06 PM, Butz's arrival at 11:05 PM would mean he took 20 minutes to walk 5 minutes. That's a contradiction. Therefore, the evidence (7) and testimony (5) contradict. 

But wait, Evidence 7's notes include: 'Butz:\nHold on... Well, it had pretty much stopped snowing... I guess about a five-minute walk?' So the five-minute walk is from the shack to the bridge. So if the snow stopped around 10:50 PM, and Butz left after that, he would arrive at the bridge at 10:55 PM. But Phoenix arrives at 11:06 PM. That's 11 minutes later, which contradicts Testimony 5 where he says Nick arrived less than a minute later. So this is a contradiction between Testimony 5 and Evidence 7. 

Therefore, the correct pair would be evidence 7 and testimony 5. But I need to check the numbers. Testimony 5 is "I arrived at the bridge, and Nick showed up less than a minute later." Evidence 7 states the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, and Phoenix found the body at 11:06 PM. Therefore, if Butz arrived at the bridge at 10:55 PM (5 minutes after snow stops), Phoenix arrived 11 minutes later. That's a contradiction. 

Therefore, the answer should be evidence 7 and testimony 5. 

But wait, the user wants only one pair. Another possible contradiction: Testimony 1: Butz says he was lying under bedding when a white flash almost blinded him. That's the lightning strike. If the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, that's when he saw the flash. But according to the weather data, lightning was from 10 PM to 11 PM. So that's consistent. 

Another angle: The Shichishito (Evidence 10) is said to have the victim's blood and suspect's fingerprints but is not the murder weapon. The actual weapon is the staff (Evidence 9). So if the Shichishito was planted, perhaps a testimony contradicts that, but the user is asking for a contradiction between evidence and testimony. 

Alternatively, Testimony 6: Butz says he thought he'd never get another chance to see something so big burning. But if the fire was caused by lightning, that's natural, but maybe he had prior knowledge. Not sure. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0 again. If he went to the shack at 9 PM and stayed until 10:30 PM, but according to the snow timeline, snow was until 10:50 PM. So when he left the shack at 10:30 PM, it was still snowing, but he says in the conversation (in Evidence 7) that when he went out, the snow had stopped. So that's a contradiction. Thus, Testimony 0 (saying he left the shack at 10:30 PM) and Evidence 7 (snow stopped at 10:50 PM) contradict because he should have still been in snow when he left, but he claims the snow had stopped. Therefore, Evidence 7 and Testimony 0. 

But the user wants the evidence and testimony numbers. Testimony 0 is Butz's first testimony. Evidence 7 is the weather data. So the answer would be {"evidence":7, "testimony":0}. 

But wait, in the conversation within Evidence 7, Butz says that when he went out, the snow had pretty much stopped, which would align with 10:50 PM. However, if he went to the shack at 9 PM and stayed until 10:30 PM, when he left at 10:30 PM, the snow was still ongoing (until 10:50 PM). So his Testimony 0 (time he was at the shack) contradicts the Weather Data's snow end time. So if he left at 10:30 PM, he would have been in snow, but he says the snow had stopped. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 0 and Evidence 7. 

Yes, this seems correct. So the answer is Evidence 7 and Testimony 0.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So, the task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. I need to go through them step by step.

First, let's look at the testimonies. The testimonies given are from Larry Butz (Testimony 0 to 4). Testimony 2 says he saw Iris flying with her white hood fluttering. But according to Evidence 6, Iris's Hood was given to Phoenix before the lights out bell at 10 PM. If Iris gave her hood to Phoenix, she wouldn't have been wearing it when Larry claims he saw her. That seems like a contradiction. 

Wait, let me check the timing. The lights out bell was at 10 PM, right? So Iris gave the hood to Phoenix before that. Larry's testimony about seeing her with the hood would be after she had already given it away. Therefore, Larry couldn't have seen Iris wearing the hood during the time he claims. That's a direct contradiction between Testimony 2 (Larry seeing Iris in the hood) and Evidence 6 (Iris not having the hood anymore after 10 PM). 

Another possible contradiction might be with the weather data. Evidence 7 mentions lightning at 10:45 PM. But Larry's Testimony 4 talks about flames going out and someone coming up. However, I'm not sure if that directly contradicts. The main clear contradiction seems to be the hood. So the evidence number 6 and testimony number 2 contradict each other.

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 2}
